lines.text: Well, let's face it, I'm not well!

Peggy, did it ever occur to you that to me you'll always be beautiful no matter how old you grow? I'll always remember you as you were the last day I saw you - young, beautiful, bright, excitimg. No one who can see can say that to you. Peg, you're so beautiful... so beautiful outside... so rotten inside.
You know I don't understand much about painting.
There's nothing much to understand. It hasn't anything to do with the brain. It's the eye. A painting's like a woman. She either thrills you or she doesn't.

[to Scott, who's clutching a dead man's life jacket he has found]
If you're so afraid about ghosts, Lieutenant, what about that jacket you're holding?

[Admiring the paintings]
These must be worth a fortune now that you're...
a man never gets rich until he's dead. I assure you a blind painter's just the same as a dead man.
